creator: eric.dalquist@doit.wisc.edu
text:
Created attachment 22265
Minimal diff against 2.3.2 to add this functionality

To allow for specific CR, LF or CRLF patterns along with other control codes an option should be added to the TCP Sampler to allow for use of Java escape codes in the sampler text.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
A very good idea - but I don't see why it should be limited to the TCP Sampler.

I've just implemented something similar as a function:

__char(n,m,,,)

which allows Unicode characters to be entered.

I think this could also be added as a function so it would work for all samplers.

creator: eric.dalquist@doit.wisc.edu
text: Sounds like a great solution as well. Our only requirement is to be able to specify the exact format of line-feeds so any solution to that problem is good.

The char function is in nightly builds from 677138 (inclusive) if you want to give that a try.

Although providing similar functionality, I think an unescape function will be useful too - probably easier to use in a lot of cases.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
This can be achieved with the various new functions:

__char()
__unescape()
